### Navigate the file system

Identify a folder on your computer where you (want to) keep course-related files.
If you don't have one, choose a suitable location in your file system.

1. Navigate into the chosen location using the command line.
2. Use the command line to display the path of your chosen folder.
What is the output?

### Create files and folders

3. Within your chosen folder, create a new subfolder and give it a relevant name (e.g., `recipes` or `city-guide`).
4. Navigate into the newly created subfolder.
5. Create a new text file and name it approriately (e.g., `recipes.txt` or `city-guide.txt`).
6. Confirm that the files was created by listing the contents of the folder.
